e4: Maintaining the current policy is ethically questionable, even if it benefits short-term stock prices.  Switching to the new policy fosters long-term trust with investors, aligns with ethical business practices, and strengthens the company's reputation.  While there will be an initial adjustment,  the transparent approach is ultimately the best strategy.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency, accuracy, and fairness.  It provides a complete and unbiased picture of the company's financial performance, without misleading or manipulating information.  It should also consider all stakeholders, including investors, employees, and the broader community.  Consistency over time is crucial for building trust and maintaining credibility.
e6: I would ask about the specifics of the investor relations plan to mitigate the negative market reaction to the policy change.  I'd also want to understand their assessment of the potential impact on different investor groups (retail vs. institutional) and what steps they'll take to ensure fair treatment of all investors during the transition.
